required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long-term Study of ADVM-022 in Neovascular (Wet) AMD [OPTIC-EXT]
clinical_study.official_title: A Long-term Study of ADVM-022 in Neovascular (Wet) AMD - OPTIC Extension

brief_summary.textblock: ADVM-022-07 is an observational long-term extension (OPTIC-EXT) study assessing safety and efficacy of ADVM-022 gene therapy product, in subjects with neovascular, or exudative (wet), age-related macular degeneration (nAMD).

detailed_description.textblock:
ADVM-022 (AAV.7m8-aflibercept) is a gene therapy product developed for the treatment of neovascular (wet) age-related macular degeneration (wet AMD). Wet AMD is a serious condition and the leading cause of blindness in the elderly. The available therapies for treating wet AMD require life-long intravitreal (IVT) injections every 4-12 weeks to maintain efficacy. A one-time IVT administration of ADVM-022 has the potential to treat wet AMD by providing durable expression of therapeutic levels of intraocular anti-VEGF protein (aflibercept) and maintaining the vision of patients. ADVM-022 is designed to reduce the current treatment burden which often results in undertreatment and vision loss in patients with wet AMD receiving anti-VEGF therapy in clinical practice.
ADVM-022-07 is an observational long-term extension (OPTIC-EXT) study assessing safety and efficacy of ADVM-022 gene therapy product, in subjects with neovascular, or exudative (wet), age-related macular degeneration (nAMD).
To evaluate potential long-term outcomes of ADVM-022, the OPTIC-EXT will follow subjects previously treated in the OPTIC parent study (Clinical Protocol No. ADVM-022-01 [OPTIC] (NCT03748784)). Subjects will roll over from the OPTIC parent study and will be followed for 3 additional years, following completion of the preceding 2-year assessment period in the OPTIC parent study. There is no investigational treatment administered in this study.

primary_outcome.measure: Type, severity and incidence of ocular and systemic adverse events (AEs).
primary_outcome.description: Type, severity and incidence of ocular and systemic adverse events

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in best corrected visual acuity (BCVA) from baseline, over time
secondary_outcome.description: Change in best corrected visual acuity (BCVA) from baseline, over time

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean change in central subfield thickness (CST) and macular volume from baseline, over time
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change in central subfield thickness (CST) and macular volume from baseline, over time

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects requiring supplemental aflibercept over time
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects requiring supplemental aflibercept over time

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean number of supplemental aflibercept injections over time
secondary_outcome.description: Mean number of supplemental aflibercept injections over time

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects without intraretinal fluid (IRF) by spectral domain optical coherence tomography (SD-OCT), over time
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects without intraretinal fluid (IRF) by spectral domain optical coherence tomography (SD-OCT), over time

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects without subretinal fluid (SRF) by SD-OCT over time
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects without subretinal fluid (SRF) by SD-OCT over time

arm_group.description: Subjects with wet AMD who received any dose of ADVM-022 in a prior clinical study.

intervention.description: Long term follow-up of subjects that received ADVM-022

study_pop.textblock:
- Subjects who received ADVM-022 at any dose in the OPTIC study
- Up to 30 subjects from all cohorts of OPTIC

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who received a single dose of ADVM-022 at any dose in the OPTIC study
- Willing and able to provide informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- None
